answers.content_html: Kinematics is the study of motion.
answers.feedback_html: The motion of a body is studied under kinematics.

answers.content_html: Kinematics is the study of the cause of motion.
answers.feedback_html: Force and its effects are studied under dynamics.

answers.content_html: Kinematics is the study of dimensions.
answers.feedback_html: Dimensions are studied under theoretical physics, not classical mechanics.

answers.content_html: Kinematics is the study of atomic structures.
answers.feedback_html: Atomic structure is studied under atomic physics, not classical mechanics.
Scalar quantities have magnitude but lack a direction.
Force is a vector quantity because it has direction and magnitude.

answers.content_html: Force is both a vector quantity and a scalar quantity.
answers.feedback_html: Vector quantities have both direction and magnitude while scalar quantities lack a direction. Therefore a quantity cannot be both a vector and a scalar.

answers.content_html: Force is neither a vector nor a scalar quantity.
answers.feedback_html: In physics all quantities are either vector or scalar. Vector quantities are those with direction and magnitude while scalar quantities have magnitude only.

stem_html: What kind of physical quantity is force?
